intro: Lampranthus austricola, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from red to orange, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Lampranthus austricola is a succulent plant, capable of storing water in its fleshy leaves and stems.
